Course Length and Format

 

Average course completion time: 3.5 hours

You can enhance your learning in this course by doing the following:

  • Gain new knowledge and skills through readings, narrated PowerPoints, videos, and reflections.

  • Use your own personal journal to jot down your ideas—for your eyes only. Follow this link for more information.

  • Reach out and connect with other educators by commenting in the course thread in the LINCS Communities of Practice. Go to the Invitation to Check in with Other Educators Page Invitation to Check in with Other Educators Page for more information.

  • Earn a certificate of completion by viewing all activities in the course (unless marked "optional"), completing all quizzes with a score of at least 75% (7.5 points out of 10 possible), and by spending a total of at least 2 hours in the course (you may do this in smaller chunks of time). Please note that the checkmark for some items may not appear as "viewed" until after this course page is refreshed.

 

Course Objectives

 

Upon successful completion of this online course, participants will be able to do the following:

  • Identify strategies that motivate adult learners to persist and describe examples of their application;

  • Observe an adult education class and describe how these strategies are being implemented; and

  • Select three course resources to support your implementation of motivation and persistence strategies in your practice.
